metadata.title: CVE-2024-23851 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
copy_params in drivers/md/dm-ioctl.c in the Linux kernel through 6.7.1 canattempt to allocate more than INT_MAX bytes, and crash, because of amissing param_kernel->data_size check. This is related to ctl_ioctl.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-23851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.136').
